info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:29PM MDT until further notice by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL HAAKON...SOUTHWESTERN ZIEBACH...SOUTHEASTERN MEADE AND NORTHEASTERN PENNINGTON COUNTIES... At 528 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Creighton, or 31 miles northwest of Philip, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas southwest of Bridger and northeast of Elm Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
